q4.description: Example, \Sigma=\{a, b, c\}, \Gamma = \{0,1\}, the homomorphism function is defined as: $h(a) = 11$, $h(b) = 00$, and $h(c) = 0$
q4.question: What is the value of h(bc)?

q5.description: Example, \Sigma=\{a, b, c\}, \Gamma = \{0,1\}, the homomorphism function is defined as: $h(a) = 11$, $h(b) = 00$, and $h(c) = 0$
q5.question: What is the value of h(ab^*)?

q6.description: Example, \Sigma=\{a, b\}, \Gamma = \{a,b,c\}, the homomorphism function is defined as: $h(a) = ab$, $h(b) = bbc$
q6.question: What is the value of h(aa)?

q7.description: Example, \Sigma=\{a, b\}, \Gamma = \{a,b,c\}, the homomorphism function is defined as: $h(a) = ab$, $h(b) = bbc$
q7.question: What is the value of h(aba)?

q8.description: Example, \Sigma=\{0, 1\}, \Gamma = \{a, b\}, the homomorphism function is defined as: $h(0) = ab$, $h(1) = \lambda$
q8.question: What is the value of h(01010)?

q11.description: Example, \Sigma=\{a, b\}, \Gamma = \{b, c, d\}, the homomorphism function is defined as: $h(a) = db$, $h(b) = cc$
q11.question: What is the value of $h((a + b^*)^*)$?

q12.description: Example, \Sigma=\{a, b\}, \Gamma = \{b, c, d\}, the homomorphism function is defined as: $h(a) = db$, $h(b) = cc$
q12.question: [T|F]The result for $h((a + b^*)^*)$ is a regular expression.

q13.description: Example, \Sigma=\{a, b\}, \Gamma = \{b, c, d\}, the homomorphism function is defined as: $h(a) = db$, $h(b) = cc$
q13.question: [T|F]The resulting language is regular.
